So, the workweek is over and everybody has finally had time to hurt
themselves with the various APIs \u2013 including both the Adapter API, the
Taxonomy API and the REST API.

So, time has come for feedback.

* Are there bad choices that are going to hurt us?
* What is missing that we should implement soon?
* What is annoying that we should improve soon?
* Anything else?

body.plain:
On 03/30/2016 08:53 AM, David Rajchenbach-Teller wrote:
> So, the workweek is over and everybody has finally had time to hurt
> themselves with the various APIs \u2013 including both the Adapter API, the
> Taxonomy API and the REST API.
>
> So, time has come for feedback.
>
> * Are there bad choices that are going to hurt us?
> * What is missing that we should implement soon?
> * What is annoying that we should improve soon?
> * Anything else?

I think we need to list for each adapter, which getter/setter was 
implemented and if we had to workaround limitations of the current 
system. For instance, I'm pretty sure that exposing CRUD-like systems or 
very dynamic collections of channels is not very well catered for. 
Having getter parameters would help a lot.

-- 
Fabrice Desr�
Connected Devices
Mozilla Corporation

improve this? What's the best way to send binary data to a client or to
receive Binary data from the client?

Opened issue here: https://github.com/fxbox/taxonomy/issues/37

Cheers,
 David

data.Subject: Github wiki vs Mozilla wiki
data.X-Abuse-and-DMCA-Info: Otherwise we will be unable to process your complaint properly
data.X-Spam-Status:
No, score=-0.039 tagged_above=-999 required=5
	tests=[BAYES_00=-0.05, HTML_MESSAGE=0.001, T_DKIM_INVALID=0.01]
	autolearn=ham

body.html:
Hello folks,

during yesterday's weekly meeting we talked about the need of starting to document the decisions that we are taking for Link. One of the questions was about whether we should use Github's or Mozilla's wiki for it. Both options looks good to me, but since there's already  some documentation at [1], I'll start adding more documentation there tomorrow unless someone disagrees and prefers Github's option.

Cheers,

/ Fernando

[1] https://wiki.mozilla.org/Project_Link
